Description: Postcard; printed paper; shows the Red Sea canal bureau offices by the harbour at Port Said.
Curator's comments: Old card; good condition; postally used. The message reads: "My darling mother. I hope you are quite well. When are you going to write to me? I have been put into the Secrety Society in my class & hold the position of honour. I will write to you soon. I have hurt my finger again. I did it in my sleep. I hope it doesn't get bad again. Love to you both" and ends with multiple kisses and is signed Dora. Note that the message is written at 180 degrees to the address in an effort to prevent the postman from reading it when he was sorting or delivering the post.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Mrs C G Johnson
